intro: Phanerophlebiopsis balansae, commonly known as the Balansae fern, is a rare and delicate species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, lanceolate fronds that are typically green and glossy. The plant exhibits a cryptic growth habit, often growing in shaded, moist environments such as rocky crevices or forest floors. Its sporangia are clustered in sori along the margins of the fronds, a typical feature of ferns. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
